updateDownloaded.message: The update {0} released on {1} has been downloaded. It will be applied the next time the application is started.
updateDownloaded.title: Update {0} ready

updateError.message: An error occurred while updating FAT with the following massage: {0}
updateError.title: Update failed

main.description: Other features will be added soon!
main.subtitle: Administration tool for Flyff servers

testFailed.message: Connection to DSN "{0}" failed. If you are using Integrated Windows authentication, the user used to launch FAT may not be allowed to log in. The DSN may also not be able to accept connections made by this test. Only DSNs for SQL servers are supported by FAT.
testFailed.title: Connection failed

testSucceeded.message: Connection to DSN "{0}" was successful. If your server has been configured with its settings, it should also have access to it.
testSucceeded.title: Connection succeeded

dataSourceNames.empty: No DSN meeting your search criteria was found on your system.
dataSourceNames.subtitle: Check that your DSN (Data Source Name) are correctly configured, according to the needs of your Flyff server. You can test them individually to validate that they work. The test consists of opening a connection to the connection string associated with the DSN. Note however that the tests will be performed with the same user as the one used to launch FAT. DSNs using Integrated Windows Authentication will display an error during the test if they are configured to use another user.
dataSourceNames.title: Configured DSNs

drivers.empty: No ODBC driver meeting your search criteria was found on your system.
drivers.subtitle: Verify that the ODBC drivers that your Flyff server needs are installed on your system. Otherwise, you can install them using versions included in Microsoft SQL Server installers or independently, by downloading them directly from Micrososft.
drivers.title: Installed ODBC drivers

filter.activeDriversOnlyLabel: Only show ODBC drivers that are used by at least one DSN
filter.subtitle: Start by providing keywords to filter the names of ODBC drivers or data sources to process.
filter.textLabel: Name of the ODBC drivers or DSNs to search
filter.title: Filter

terms.acceptGdprLabel: I accept the GDPR privacy clause
terms.acceptLicenseLabel: I accept the terms of use
terms.description: The speed test is carried out with the CLI and Ookla services. It should give the same results as on the website or on official applications. Ookla is not affiliated with FAT because the application uses Ookla Open Source resources, without any particular partnership. You will still have to accept Ookla's terms of use and confidentiality clause to launch the test.
terms.subTitle: Test carried out with the Ookla CLI
terms.title: Speed Test with Ookla

connection.connectionError: An error occurred while connecting to the DSN: {0}
connection.databaseDescription: The name of the database as configured in the ODBC DSNs.
connection.driverDescription: Flyff databases generally use "SQL Server Native Client 10.0" or higher.
connection.title: ODBC DSN connection
connection.trustedConnectionDescription: Connect with the current user (the one who launched FAT).

procedure.error: An error occurred while retrieving stored procedures: {0}
procedure.tip: You can double-click on a line to prefill a query on the stored procedure in question. If a stored procedure exposes multiple parameters, all of its lines will prefill the same request with all of its parameters.
procedure.title: Stored procedures

query.requestError: An error occurred during the request: {0}
query.title: Query

tables.error: An error occurred while retrieving the tables: {0}
tables.schemaDescription: MS SQL databases for Flyff generally use "dbo" for their tables.
tables.tip: You can double-click on a line to prefill a query on the table in question.
tables.title: Tables

workspace.connected: Connection to the ODBC DSN is established. You can execute your queries on it.
workspace.notConnected: Connection to the ODBC DSN is inactive. Please establish a connection in order to make your requests.
workspace.title: SQL workspace

cpu.speed: {0} GHz max. / {1} GHz min. / {2} GHz avg.
cpu.title: CPU

processes.experimentalWarning: This section is experimental! You will find very detailed technical information there. You can do without them to manage your server but they could be useful in very specific cases.
processes.title: Running processes

processes.encodingLabel: Encoding of standard outputs (stdout and stderr)
processes.metricsSpan: The metrics will display a time span of: {0}
processes.noExecutable: You have not yet configured an executable in your Workflow. Please add them first by clicking on the "@: views.workflow.sections.settings.editWorkflowButton" button above. Once your Workflow configured, you can start and stop your executables, as well as monitor them during their execution.
processes.noMetric: No metric is available for this executable.
processes.stdinLabel: Instruction to send to the process
processes.title: Processes monitoring

settings.isAnExecutableRunning: The workflow will not be editable until all the executables are stopped.
settings.isStarting: Several executables are being started. The controls will be blocked until the workflow finishes its launching sequence.
settings.title: Execution settings

workflowSidebar.argsPlaceholder: Type in an argument then press "Enter" to add it
